info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 7:38PM CDT until March 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...WINTRY MIX IMPACTS CENTRAL WISCONSIN FOR SUNDAY...
.A band of snow mixed with freezing rain overspreads central Wisconsin early Sunday morning, transitioning to a rain and snow mix by mid-morning and persisting into Sunday night. There will be a sharp cutoff in snow amounts along the western side of this storm, with total snow amounts quickly plummeting as one travels west.
Be on the lookout for slick spots on area roads, especially late tonight through mid to late morning on Sunday. Conditions may improve for the late morning and afternoon hours on Sunday depending on snowfall rates, surface temperatures, and road treatments.
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches, locally higher in eastern Taylor County, and ice accumulations around a light glaze. There will be a sharp cutoff in snow amounts as one travels west across Taylor County.
* WHERE...Taylor County.
* WHEN...From 3 AM Sunday to 7 AM CDT Monday. Impacts may be lessened during the late morning and afternoon hours depending on the exact temperatures and road treatments.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SUNDAY TO 7 AM CDT MONDAY
